enum16.name: Object Type
enum16.tooltip: changing this would not be wise

bit.name: Object Uses Only Own Static Lightmap
Search Cardinal Direction Lightmaps On Failure
Extension Of Parent
bit.tooltip: object uses parent's markers

bit.name: Sample Environment Lighting Only Ignore Object Lighting
Effects Created By This Object Do Not Spawn Objects In Multiplayer
Does Not Collide With Camera
bit.tooltip: force camera not to collide with object. By default small sweetener objects do not collide

bit.name: Force Collide With Camera
bit.tooltip: force the camera to collide with this object, By default small sweetener objects do not collide

bit.name: Damage Not Blocked By Obstructions
bit.tooltip: AOE damage being applied to this object does not test for obstrutions.

bit.name: Grab Parent Object In Forge Editing
Never Use Imposter For Shadow Generation

float32.name: Bounding Radius
float32.tooltip: If you edit this field manually, beware that the render model is no longer respected for radius calculation and that you need to set the bounding offset as well.

float32.name: Dynamic Light Sphere Radius
float32.tooltip: sphere to use for dynamic lights and shadows. only used if not 0

tagRef.name: Collision Damage
tagRef.tooltip: only set this tag if you want to override the default collision damage values in globals.globals

stringid.name: Node Name
stringid.tooltip: empty means object space

tagRef.name: Melee Sound
tagRef.tooltip: this is the sound that is made when I am meleed. This overrides the sweetener sound of my material.

float32.name: Self-Destruct Time
float32.tooltip: if non-zero, any instances of this object will destroy themselves after this many seconds.

stringid.name: AI Type Name
stringid.tooltip: used for combat dialogue, etc.

stringid.name: Interaction Name
stringid.tooltip: if you checked the consider for interaction flag, type what interaction the AI should do with this object

bit.name: Invert
bit.tooltip: result of function is one minus actual result

bit.name: Mapping Does Not Controls Active
bit.tooltip: the curve mapping can make the function active/inactive

bit.name: Always Active
bit.tooltip: function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound

bit.name: Random Time Offset
bit.tooltip: function offsets periodic function input by random value between 0 and 1

bit.name: Always Exports Value
bit.tooltip: when this function is deactivated, it still exports its value

bit.name: Turn Off With Uses Magnitude
bit.tooltip: the function will be turned off if the value of the turns_off_with function is 0

stringid.name: Import Name
stringid.tooltip: if you leave this field blank then you can set this function's input value with the hs_function object_set_function_variable

stringid.name: Turn Off With
stringid.tooltip: if the specified function is off, so is this function

stringid.name: Ranged Interpolation Name
stringid.tooltip: if you have the ranged button checked

float32.name: Minimum Value
float32.tooltip: function must exceed this value (after mapping) to be active 0. means do nothing

tagblock.name: Interpolation

option.name: Fractional
option.tooltip: covers a fixed fraction of the distance to the target on each update

float32.name: Linear Travel Time
float32.tooltip: used by constant velocity

float32.name: Acceleration
float32.tooltip: used by linear acceleration

tagblock.comment: the damping ratio is c/(2*sqrt(k)). if this ratio is: = 0 : oscillates forever < 1 : oscillates with decreasing amplitude = 1 : reaches the target precisely and quickly (no oscillation) > 1 : reaches the target slowly the higher the value of k, the quicker the system will reach the target value

float32.name: Spring k
float32.tooltip: used by damped spring, determines acceleration by displacement

float32.name: Spring c
float32.tooltip: used by damped spring, determines damping based on velocity

float32.name: Fraction
float32.tooltip: used by fractional, how mush of the distance to the target to cover each update

int32.name: Runtime Interpolator To Object Function Mapping

rangef.name: Selection Bounds
rangef.tooltip: if the switch function is between these values, this function will be picked

bit.name: Update State Animation and Keyframe Rigid Bodies Every Frame
Force Always On
bit.tooltip: when this flag is clear we only create the attachment when the function object function is active or set to empty string

bit.name: Effect Size Scale From Object Scale
Works On Land
bit.tooltip: drives on an extruded version of everything physical in your level

stringId.name: Variant Name
stringId.tooltip: if empty, may be used by any model variant

bit.name: Blend In HSV
bit.tooltip: blends colors in hsv rather than rgb space

bit.name: ...More Colors
bit.tooltip: blends colors through more hues (goes the long way around the color wheel)

tagblock.name: Multiplayer Object

flags8.name: Game Engine Flags
flags8.tooltip: Set which game engines you desire this object to appear in

tagblock.comment: Type pertains to how you want the game engine to handle this object Certain flags applicable only to certain object types, should be self evident
These fields are only used for goal area objects with boundaries, and for respawn zones
These fields are used for default spawning times and remapping
These are respawn zone weights, used only for respawn zones

tagblock.name: Falloff Function
tagblock.tooltip: Multiplier applied to weight (domain is center to radius, range should be 0 to 1).

tagblock.comment: These fields are only used for defining certain, special markers to use for positional locations if the default position (object origin) is not sufficient

tagref.name: Spawned Object
tagref.tooltip: If this object is intended to spawn something, the object it spawns should be specified here

tagref.name: Simulation Interpolation
tagref.tooltip: Set to a specific interpolation definition, or leave blank to inherit the default for the object type (there are defaults for bipeds, vehicles, and crates in multiplayer_globals). To disable interpolation on a particular object whose type has interpolation by default, set this reference to the special disable_interpolation.simulation_interpolation tag.

tagblock.name: Spawn Effects
tagblock.comment: Effect played when an object of this type spawns in during each game mode. Unlike creation effect, it is only played when the object spawns in through certain methods, not whenever one is created.

tagRef.name: Multiplayer Spawn Effect
tagRef.tooltip: effect played when this object spawns in MP games

tagRef.name: Survival Spawn Effect
tagRef.tooltip: effect played when this object spawns in Firefight games

tagRef.name: Campaign Spawn Effect
tagRef.tooltip: effect played when this object spawns in Campaign games

bit.name: Flashlight Power Doesn't Transfer To Weapon
Allow Aim While Opening Or Closing
Flying Or Vehicle Hard Pings Allowed
Attempt To Fire From Weapon Matching Camera
bit.tooltip: if this unit "fires from camera", this flag attempts to match the result, but have the projectile actually come out of the gun

bit.name: Treat As Vehicle
bit.tooltip: Treats a non-vehicle unit as a vehicle for gameplay purposes. Mantis (biped) hack.

bit.name: Hard Pings Not Allowed For Driver-Less Vehicle
No Friendly Bump Damage
bit.tooltip: Unit does not inflict collision damage to friendly units

bit.name: Ignores Attachment Feedback Forced Hard Pings
bit.tooltip: ignores hard pings forced by attachment of sticky grenade

bit.name: Unit Appears On Radar As Dot Not Sprite
bit.tooltip: do not try to find a sprite for this unit. Just draw a dot.

bit.name: Do Not Ignore Parents For Line Of Sight Tests
bit.tooltip: ai that are operating this unit will not ignore the unit's parents when doing line of sight tests (Mammoth turret hack)

bit.name: Do Not Pass Attached AOE Damage To Children
bit.tooltip: projectiles attached to this object do not do attached damage to the object's children (regular aoe damage is still done to top level aoe children)

bit.name: Do Not Generate AI Line Of Fire Pill For Unit
bit.tooltip: even if this vehicle is being driven by a friendly character, don't generate a pill for it during ai line of fire checks (for very large vehicles i.e. the lich)

option.name: Silent
option.tooltip: ai will not respond to this sound

option.name: Loud
option.tooltip: ai can hear this sound at any range

bit.name: Hides Player-Unit From Camera
bit.tooltip: the player controlling this camera will not see their unit. All other cameras will see this unit

bit.name: Use Aiming Vector Instead Of Marker Forward
bit.tooltip: for cameras without tracks that use a marker position, specifies that we use the unit's aiming vector instead of the marker's forward vector. This results in more accurate aiming and smoother movement when frames are dropped

degree.name: Look Acceleration
degree.tooltip: if non-zero, limits the change in look velocity per second while the user is pushing the look stick in the current direction of looking

degree.name: Look Deceleration
degree.tooltip: if non-zero, limits the change in look velocity per second while the user is not pushing the look stick or changing directions

float32.name: Look Acceleration Smoothing Fraction
float32.tooltip: if non-zero, when the desired velocity change is less than this fraction of the acceleration, starts interpolating the maximum acceleration towards zero. You can think of this as a time in seconds where if the velocity would reach its target in this amount of time or less, it will start taking longer.

degree.name: Override Field Of View
degree.tooltip: if non-zero, overrides the FOV set in the unit or globals

float32.name: Cylinder Fraction
float32.tooltip: controls how far from the focus point the outer raycasts start. 0 == cone, 1 == cylinder

degree.name: Obstruction Test Angle
degree.tooltip: how wide of a cone to test

float32.name: Obstruction Maximum Inward Acceleration
float32.tooltip: how quickly the camera moves inward when it anticipates a collision

float32.name: Obstruction Maximum Outward Acceleration
float32.tooltip: how quickly the camera returns to a normal position when its anticipated distance is further than its current

float32.name: Obstruction Maximum Velocity
float32.tooltip: maximum speed the camera can move

float32.name: Obstruction Return Delay
float32.tooltip: when the camera wants to start moving back out, wait this long before doing so

float32.name: Maximum Camera Velocity
float32.tooltip: how quickly the camera can move to a new displacement (if the velocity suddenly changes). During this time the aim vector for the unit will be inaccurate, so don't set this too low. 0 defaults to infinite.

float32.name: Maximum Value
float32.tooltip: for linear velocity; this is wu/s. for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration. for angular velocity; this is deg/s

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.name: Maximum Value
float32.tooltip: for linear velocity; this is wu/s. for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration. for angular velocity; this is deg/s

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.name: Maximum Value
float32.tooltip: for linear velocity; this is wu/s. for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration. for angular velocity; this is deg/s

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.name: Peg Threshold
float32.tooltip: [0,1] magnitude of analog input for pegged acceleration to kick in

point2.name: Pegged Time
point2.tooltip: time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect

point2.name: Pegged Scale
point2.tooltip: the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

degree.name: Peg Maximum Angular Velocity
degree.tooltip: the maximum turning speed during peg

float32.name: Peg Threshold
float32.tooltip: [0,1] magnitude of analog input for pegged acceleration to kick in

point2.name: Pegged Time
point2.tooltip: time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect

point2.name: Pegged Scale
point2.tooltip: the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

degree.name: Peg Maximum Angular Velocity
degree.tooltip: the maximum turning speed during peg

bit.name: Hides Player-Unit From Camera
bit.tooltip: the player controlling this camera will not see their unit. All other cameras will see this unit

bit.tooltip: for cameras without tracks that use a marker position, specifies that we use the unit's aiming vector instead of the marker's forward vector. This results in more accurate aiming and smoother movement when frames are dropped

degree.tooltip: if non-zero, limits the change in look velocity per second while the user is not pushing the look stick or changing directions

You can think of this as a time in seconds where if the velocity would reach its target in this amount of time or less, it will start taking longer.

float32.tooltip: when the camera wants to start moving back out, wait this long before doing so

float32.tooltip: for linear velocity; this is wu/s. for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration. for angular velocity; this is deg/s

float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.tooltip: for linear velocity; this is wu/s. for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration. for angular velocity; this is deg/s

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.name: Maximum Value
float32.tooltip: for linear velocity; this is wu/s. for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration. for angular velocity; this is deg/s

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)

float32.name: Peg Threshold
float32.tooltip: [0,1] magnitude of analog input for pegged acceleration to kick in

point2.name: Pegged Time
point2.tooltip: time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect

point2.name: Pegged Scale
point2.tooltip: the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

degree.name: Peg Maximum Angular Velocity
degree.tooltip: the maximum turning speed during peg

float32.name: Peg Threshold
float32.tooltip: [0,1] magnitude of analog input for pegged acceleration to kick in

point2.name: Pegged Time
point2.tooltip: time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect

point2.name: Pegged Scale
point2.tooltip: the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

degree.name: Peg Maximum Angular Velocity
degree.tooltip: the maximum turning speed during peg

stringid.name: Assassination Weapon Stow Marker
stringid.tooltip: the anchor we attach the knife to when we stow it

stringid.name: Assassination Weapon Out Marker
stringid.tooltip: the anchor we attach the knife to when we pull it out

stringid.name: Assassination Weapon Anchor Marker
stringid.tooltip: the marker on the knife that we anchor to the biped

float32.name: Soft Death Direction Speed Threshold
float32.tooltip: moving faster than this means you will soft death in the movement direction. zero defaults to damage direction.

float32.name: Pain Screen Duration
float32.tooltip: The duration of the pain function, 0 defaults to 0.5

float32.name: Pain Screen Region Fade Out Duration
float32.tooltip: The time it takes to fade out a damage region that is no longer the most recent damage region to be hit

float32.name: Pain Screen Region Fade Out Weight Threshold
float32.tooltip: The threshold weight below which the focus channel must fall before we can cross fade to another region.

degree.name: Pain Screen Angle Tolerance
degree.tooltip: The tolerance angle between next and previous damage directions, below which we randomly vary the ping direction.

degree.name: Pain Screen Angle Randomness
degree.tooltip: The maximum random angle to vary the incoming ping direction by if it's too close to the previous ping.

float32.name: Defensive Screen Duration
float32.tooltip: The duration of the defensive function, 0 defaults to 2.0

float32.name: Defensive Screen Scrub Fallback Fraction
float32.tooltip: When receiving multiple pings, this is the min percentage of the defensive screen scrub value will fallback to.

float32.name: Distance Of Dive Animation
float32.tooltip: this must be set to tell the AI how far it should expect our dive animation to move us

float32.name: Terminal Velocity Fall Ratio
float32.tooltip: ratio of airborne_arc animation to switch off falling overlay

float32.name: Stun Movement Penalty
float32.tooltip: 1.0 prevents moving while stunned

float32.name: Stun Turning Penalty
float32.tooltip: 1.0 prevents turning while stunned

float32.name: Stun Jumping Penalty
float32.tooltip: 1.0 prevents jumping while stunned

float32.name: Minimum Stun Time
float32.tooltip: all stunning damage will last for at least this long

float32.name: Maximum Stun Time
float32.tooltip: no stunning damage will last for longer than this

tagRef.name: Spawned Turret Character
tagRef.tooltip: automatically created character when this unit is driven

range16.name: Spawned Actor Count
range16.tooltip: number of actors which we spawn

float32.name: Spawned Velocity
float32.tooltip: velocity at which we throw spawned actors

stringid.name: Target Aiming Pivot Marker Name
stringid.tooltip: set this to have your weapon barrel point at its calcualed target instead of matching the aiming of the unit controlling it. This marker should be along the barrel at point that doesn't move when the barrel pitches up and down.

float32.name: Object Velocity Maximum
float32.tooltip: Debug value for object velocity that corresponds to a blend screen weight of 1, 0 defaults to 5.0

stringid.name: Right Hand Node
stringid.tooltip: where the primary weapon is attached

stringid.name: Left Hand Node
stringid.tooltip: where the seconday weapon is attached (for dual-pistol modes)

stringid.name: Preferred Gun Node
stringid.tooltip: if found, use this gun marker

stringid.name: Preferred Grenade Marker
stringid.tooltip: if found, use this marker to attach live grenades to

plugin.comment: These will override the righthand/lefthand nodes when the weapon matches the one used by the unit

tagRef.name: Native Melee Override
tagRef.tooltip: when set, characters will melee with these settings rather than their actual held weapon. (for characters that melee with an off hand)

int16.name: Variant Number
int16.tooltip: variant number to use this dialogue with (must match the suffix in the permutations on the unit's model)

float32.name: Maximum Firing Cone Angle
float32.tooltip: must be greater than zero for turret to fire

float32.name: Minimum Retarget Time
float32.tooltip: minimum time before autoturret will change targets

float32.name: Blind Fire Time
float32.tooltip: time after losing a target before turret stops blind firing

float32.name: Lead Fraction
float32.tooltip: 0.0 = no lead, 1.0 = perfect lead

rangef.name: Engagement Range
rangef.tooltip: when non-zero, turret will not prioritize targets above or below this range

float32.name: Proximity Score Multiplier
float32.tooltip: 0.0 = no importance, 2.0 = things that are close are twice as important

float32.name: Direction Score Multiplier
float32.tooltip: 0.0 = no importance, 2.0 = things in front of you are twice as important

float32.name: Attacker Score Multiplier
float32.tooltip: 0.0 = no importance, 2.0 = things that attacked you last are twice as important

float32.name: Caution Duration
float32.tooltip: how long the turret stays alert after losing a target

float32.name: Alert Angular Speed Maximum
float32.tooltip: 0 = infinite

float32.name: Idle Angular Speed Maximum
float32.tooltip: 0 = infinite

rangef.name: Targeting Yaw
rangef.tooltip: [-180, 0] [0, 180] how far it can rotate past its initial rotation

rangef.name: Targeting Pitch
rangef.tooltip: [-180, 0],[0, 180] how far it can rotate past its initial rotation

rangef.name: Idle Scanning Yaw
rangef.tooltip: [-180, 0],[0, 180] how far it will look around past its initial rotation

rangef.name: Idle Scanning Pitch
rangef.tooltip: [-180, 0],[0, 180] how far it will look around past its initial rotation

float32.name: Idle Scanning Minimum Interest Distance
float32.tooltip: 0 = infinite. Idle scanning won't look at something that is closer than this distance

tagRef.name: Alert Mode Effect
tagRef.tooltip: effect played on the turret when it goes into alert mode

bit.name: Suppress Secondary Barrel For Light Vehicles
bit.tooltip: Can be used to prevent turret from using its big guns on a mongoose

bit.name: Only Use Vehicle Range Scale If Secondary Barrel Active
Only Use Vehicle Score Bonus If Secondary Barrel Active

float32.name: Sight Cone Angle
float32.tooltip: the cone that this sentry actually sees with; only used when scanning

float32.name: Alert Range
float32.tooltip: how far the sentry can see (sentry will track enemies within alert range, but not necessarily fire)

float32.name: Attack Range
float32.tooltip: how far the sentry can shoot

float32.name: Attack Range Score Multiplier
float32.tooltip: 0 = No preference to targets in attack range; 0.5 = Targets in attack range get 50% score bonus

float32.name: Light Vehicle Range Scale
float32.tooltip: 0 = Default of 1; 1.5 = light vehicles are attacked at 1.5x attack range

float32.name: Heavy Vehicle Range Scale
float32.tooltip: 0 = Default of 1; 1.5 = light vehicles are attacked at 1.5x attack range

float32.name: Flying Vehicle Range Scale
float32.tooltip: 0 = Default of 1; 1.5 = light vehicles are attacked at 1.5x attack range

float32.name: Light Vehicle Score Bonus
float32.tooltip: 0 = No bonus preference for light vehicles; 0.5 = 50% score bonus for light vehicles

float32.name: Heavy Vehicle Score Bonus
float32.tooltip: 0 = No bonus preference for heavy vehicles; 0.5 = 50% score bonus for heavy vehicles

float32.name: Flying Vehicle Score Bonus
float32.tooltip: 0 = No bonus preference for flying vehicles; 0.5 = 50% score bonus for flying vehicles

float32.name: Primary Fire Time
float32.tooltip: how long the sentry waits before using its primary weapon barrel

float32.name: Secondary Fire Time
float32.tooltip: how long the sentry waits before using its secondary weapon barrel

tagRef.name: Player Entered Alert Range Sound
tagRef.tooltip: 1st person sound to play when targeted player enters sentry's alert range

tagRef.name: Player Exited Alert Range Sound
tagRef.tooltip: 1st person sound to play when targeted player leaves sentry's alert range

tagblock.name: Tracking Types
tagblock.tooltip: specify the kinds of targets this tracking system can lock on

tagblock.name: Seats

bit.name: Invisible
bit.tooltip: completely enclosed by vehicle

bit.name: Locked
bit.tooltip: when occupied, prevents enemies from entering locked seats

bit.name: First Person Camera Slaved To Gun
AI Firing Disabled By Maximum Acceleration
Takes Top Level Area of Effect Damage
Disallow Exit
bit.tooltip: Prevents the unit currently in the seat from exiting regardless of circumstances

bit.name: Gunner Release Aim On Exit
bit.tooltip: The unit's aim will no longer be controlled by gunner when it exits

bit.name: Kill Parent If Unit In Seat Dies
Co-Pilot
bit.tooltip: opens and closes the cockpit to allow copilot in (if already closed)

float32.name: Turnover Time
float32.tooltip: how much time it takes to evict a rider from a flipped vehicle

float32.name: Listener Interpolation Factor
float32.tooltip: how far to interpolate listener position from camera to occupant's head

tagblock.comment: when the unit velocity is 0, the yaw/pitch rates are the left values at [max speed reference], the yaw/pitch rates are the right values. the max speed reference is what the code uses to generate a clamped speed from 0..1 the exponent controls how midrange speeds are interpreted. IOW: As velocity exceeds 'min speed' and approaches 'max speed', turn rates are scaled from low --> high

float32.name: Pitch Interpolation Time
float32.tooltip: 0 means use default 17

float32.name: Minimum Speed Reference
float32.tooltip: Initial t is computed from velocity/(max speed - min speed)

float32.name: Speed Exponent
float32.tooltip: if >0, t is then modified by raising to this exponent and result is used to linearly interpolate yaw/pitch rates

bit.name: Hides Player-Unit From Camera
bit.tooltip: the player controlling this camera will not see their unit. All other cameras will see this unit

bit.name: Use Aiming Vector Instead Of Marker Forward
bit.tooltip: for cameras without tracks that use a marker position, specifies that we use the unit's aiming vector instead of the marker's forward vector. This results in more accurate aiming and smoother movement when frames are dropped

degree.name: Look Acceleration
degree.tooltip: if non-zero, limits the change in look velocity per second while the user is pushing the look stick in the current direction of looking

degree.name: Look Deceleration
degree.tooltip: if non-zero, limits the change in look velocity per second while the user is not pushing the look stick or changing directions

You can think of this as a time in seconds where if the velocity would reach its target in this amount of time or less, it will start taking longer.

degree.name: Override Field Of View
degree.tooltip: if non-zero, overrides the FOV set in the unit or globals

float32.name: Cylinder Fraction
float32.tooltip: controls how far from the focus point the outer raycasts start. 0 == cone, 1 == cylinder

degree.name: Obstruction Test Angle
degree.tooltip: how wide of a cone to test

float32.tooltip: how quickly the camera moves inward when it anticipates a collision

float32.name: Obstruction Maximum Outward Acceleration
float32.tooltip: how quickly the camera returns to a normal position when its anticipated distance is further than its current

float32.name: Obstruction Maximum Velocity
float32.tooltip: maximum speed the camera can move

float32.name: Obstruction Return Delay
float32.tooltip: when the camera wants to start moving back out, wait this long before doing so

float32.name: Maximum Camera Velocity
float32.tooltip: how quickly the camera can move to a new displacement (if the velocity suddenly changes). During this time the aim vector for the unit will be inaccurate, so don't set this too low. 0 defaults to infinite.

float32.name: Maximum Value
float32.tooltip: for linear velocity; this is wu/s. for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration. for angular velocity; this is deg/s

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.tooltip: for linear velocity; this is wu/s. for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration. for angular velocity; this is deg/s

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.tooltip: for linear velocity; this is wu/s. for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration. for angular velocity; this is deg/s

float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.name: Peg Threshold
float32.tooltip: [0,1] magnitude of analog input for pegged acceleration to kick in

point2.name: Pegged Time
point2.tooltip: time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect

point2.name: Pegged Scale
point2.tooltip: the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

degree.name: Peg Maximum Angular Velocity
degree.tooltip: the maximum turning speed during peg

float32.name: Peg Threshold
float32.tooltip: [0,1] magnitude of analog input for pegged acceleration to kick in

point2.name: Pegged Time
point2.tooltip: time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect

point2.name: Pegged Scale
point2.tooltip: the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

degree.name: Peg Maximum Angular Velocity
degree.tooltip: the maximum turning speed during peg

ranged.name: Yaw For AI Operator
ranged.tooltip: only applies when an NPC is considering using this seat

float32.name: Entry Radius
float32.tooltip: how close to the entry marker a unit must be

degree.name: Entry Marker Cone Angle
degree.tooltip: angle from marker forward the unit must be

degree.name: Entry Marker Facing Angle
degree.tooltip: angle from unit facing the marker must be

stringid.name: Open Function Name
stringid.tooltip: creates an object function with this name that you can use to query the open state of this seat

stringid.name: Opening Function Name
stringid.tooltip: goes from 0 to 1 over the course of opening and stays at 1 while open. Drops to 0 immediately when closing starts

stringid.name: Closing Function Name
stringid.tooltip: goes from 0 to 1 over the course of closing and stays at 1 while closed. Drops to 0 immediately when opening starts

tagref.name: Seat Death Grab Crate
tagref.tooltip: If this unit dies while this seat is occupied, the occupant will be handed an instance of this crate for throwing purposes.

float32.name: Bailout Velocity
float32.tooltip: if exiting in bailout fashion, how much velocity to add in the entry_marker's forward direction

float32.name: Opening Time
float32.tooltip: how long the unit takes to open when the hs_function unit_open is called. The current open state can be retrieved from the object function unit_open

float32.name: Closing Time
float32.tooltip: you don't have to go home, but you can't stay here

float32.name: EMP Disabled Time Multiplayer
float32.tooltip: Set to -1 for not disabled in MP but disabled in SP

float32.name: Boost Rise Time
float32.tooltip: if the trigger is fully down, takes this long to reach peak power

float32.name: Boost Fall Time
float32.tooltip: if the trigger is let go (or peak time expires), takes this long to reach 0 power

float32.name: Boost Power Per Second
float32.tooltip: 1, means you burn all your power in one sec. .1 means you can boost for 10 seconds.

float32.name: Boost Recharge Rate
float32.tooltip: 1 means you recharge fully in 1 second. .1 means you rechage fully in 10 seconds

float32.name: Boost Recharge Delay
float32.tooltip: how long do you have to be off the tirgger for before boost starts recharging

tagref.name: Hero Assist Equipment
tagref.tooltip: this is where you stick an equipment that the biped will always have, to implement the bizarrely named hero assist

float32.name: Bailout Threshold
float32.tooltip: the speed above which units will bail out of a vehicle instead of just exiting

float32.name: Iron Sight Weapon Dampening
float32.tooltip: when using iron sights, how much to scale the weapon overlays to steady the gun (0 = rock steady, 1= no dampening)

stringid.name: Birthing Region
stringid.tooltip: if found, this region will be set to destroyed during birth

bit.name: Has Physical Rigid Bodies When Alive
Sync Action Always Projects On Ground

stringid.name: Ragdoll Region Name
stringid.tooltip: when the biped transitions to ragdoll, this region will change to the destroyed state

stringid.name: Assassination CHUD Text
stringid.tooltip: The string id for the assassination action text in the CHUD

enum8.name: Velocity Preservation
enum8.tooltip: specifies how pre-trick velocity is maintained during and after the trick. only applies to vehicles

option.name: Trick Relative
option.tooltip: velocity is relative to the object's orientation at the start of the trick (so if you're moving forward before the trick, you will be moving forward after the trick, even if that's a different direction)

option.name: World Relative
option.tooltip: velocity is maintained in world space

bit.name: Use Following Camera
bit.tooltip: as opposed to the trick camera, which is the default. vehicles only

bit.name: Do Not Slam Player Control
bit.tooltip: allows the player to continue to move aiming vector while tricking

float32.name: Camera Interpolation Time
float32.tooltip: sloppiness of the camera. only applies to vehicles

float32.name: Trick Exit Time
float32.tooltip: how long before the end of the trick we start using the below values

rangef.name: Trick Exit Camera Interpolation Time
rangef.tooltip: sloppiness of the camera when exiting the trick. we interpolate between these values depending on how far your camera was displaced from the ideal camera

float32.name: Trick Exit Displacement Reference
float32.tooltip: when your camera is this far from the ideal at the start of the trick, we use the maximum delay time above. only for space fighter

float32.name: Cooldown Time
float32.tooltip: after ending this trick, how long until I can trick again. only applies to vehicles

float32.name: Maximum Soft Landing Time
float32.tooltip: the longest amount of time the biped can take to recover from a soft landing

float32.name: Maximum Hard Landing Time
float32.tooltip: the longest amount of time the biped can take to recover from a hard landing

float32.name: Minimum Soft Landing Velocity
float32.tooltip: below this velocity the biped does not react when landing

float32.name: Minimum Hard Landing Velocity
float32.tooltip: below this velocity the biped will not do a soft landing when returning to the ground

float32.name: Maximum Hard Landing Velocity
float32.tooltip: the velocity corresponding to the maximum landing time

float32.name: Stun Duration
float32.tooltip: 0 is the default. Bipeds are stunned when damaged by vehicle collisions, also some are when they take emp damage

degree.name: Camera Interpolation Start
degree.tooltip: looking-downward angle that starts camera interpolation to fp position

degree.name: Camera Interpolation End
degree.tooltip: looking-downward angle at which camera interpolation to fp position is complete

vector3.name: Camera Offset
vector3.tooltip: amount of fp camera movement in (forward, right, down) when pitched down by 'camera interpolation end' above

enum32.name: Composition Mode
enum32.tooltip: if multiple markers share the same name, this specifies how to compose their search values

option.name: Most Compressed
option.tooltip: pick the marker that has the closest obstacle

option.name: Least Compressed
option.tooltip: pick the marker that has the furthest obstacle

option.name: Average
option.tooltip: average the distances from each marker

stringid.name: Output Function Name
stringid.tooltip: creates an object function with this name that you can use to drive an overlay animation

float32.name: Constant z Offset
float32.tooltip: camera z is modified by this constant z value

float32.name: Constant z Offset
float32.tooltip: camera z is modified by this constant z value

stringid.name: Living Global Material Name
stringid.tooltip: collision material used when character is alive

stringid.name: Dead Global Material Name
stringid.tooltip: collision material used when character is dead

bit.name: Force Enable Collision With Player
bit.tooltip: enables collision with the player regardless of the collision group

enum8.name: Collision Group
enum8.tooltip: This value overrides the default group, model, and rigid body.

uint32.name: Runtime Code Pointer
uint32.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint32.name: User Data
uint32.tooltip: The offset from the start of the block to the start of this shape (index * block element size). This becomes a pointer to this shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint32.name: Runtime Code Pointer
uint32.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint32.name: User Data
uint32.tooltip: The offset from the start of the block to the start of this shape (index * block element size). This becomes a pointer to this shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint32.name: Runtime Code Pointer
uint32.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

enum16.name: Shape Type
enum16.tooltip: this and the shape index below becomes a pointer to the given shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

bit.name: Force Enable Collision With Player
bit.tooltip: enables collision with the player regardless of the collision group

enum8.name: Collision Group
enum8.tooltip: This value overrides the default group, model, and rigid body.

uint32.name: Runtime Code Pointer
uint32.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint32.name: User Data
uint32.tooltip: The offset from the start of the block to the start of this shape (index * block element size). This becomes a pointer to this shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

bit.name: Force Enable Collision With Player
bit.tooltip: enables collision with the player regardless of the collision group

enum8.name: Collision Group
enum8.tooltip: This value overrides the default group, model, and rigid body.

uint32.name: Runtime Code Pointer
uint32.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint32.name: User Data
uint32.tooltip: The offset from the start of the block to the start of this shape (index * block element size). This becomes a pointer to this shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint32.name: Runtime Code Pointer
uint32.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint32.name: User Data
uint32.tooltip: The offset from the start of the block to the start of this shape (index * block element size). This becomes a pointer to this shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint32.name: Runtime Code Pointer
uint32.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

enum16.name: Shape Type
enum16.tooltip: this and the shape index below becomes a pointer to the given shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

bit.name: Force Enable Collision With Player
bit.tooltip: enables collision with the player regardless of the collision group

enum8.name: Collision Group
enum8.tooltip: This value overrides the default group, model, and rigid body.

uint32.name: Runtime Code Pointer
uint32.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint32.name: User Data
uint32.tooltip: The offset from the start of the block to the start of this shape (index * block element size). This becomes a pointer to this shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint32.name: Runtime Code Pointer
uint32.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint32.name: User Data
uint32.tooltip: The offset from the start of the block to the start of this shape (index * block element size). This becomes a pointer to this shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint32.name: Runtime Code Pointer
uint32.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

enum16.name: Shape Type
enum16.tooltip: this and the shape index below becomes a pointer to the given shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint32.name: Runtime Code Pointer
uint32.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint32.name: User Data
uint32.tooltip: The offset from the start of the block to the start of this shape (index * block element size). This becomes a pointer to this shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint32.name: Runtime Code Pointer
uint32.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint32.name: Runtime List Pointer
uint32.tooltip: becomes a pointer to where the child shapes for this list start in memory at runtime. don't poke me

float32.name: w Axis-Aligned Bounding Box Half Extents

enum16.name: Shape Type
enum16.tooltip: this and the shape index below becomes a pointer to the given shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

enum32.name: Collision Group
enum32.tooltip: This value overrides the default group, model, and rigid body.

degree.name: Climb Inflection Angle
degree.tooltip: angle for bipeds at which climb direction changes between up and down

float32.name: Airborne Reaction Time Scale
float32.tooltip: scale on the time for the entity to realize it is airborne

float32.name: Ground Adhesion Velocity Scale
float32.tooltip: scale on velocity with which the entity is pushed back into its ground plane (set to -1 to lock to ground)

float32.name: Gravity Scale
float32.tooltip: scale on gravity for this entity

float32.name: Airborne Acceleration Scale
float32.tooltip: scale on airborne acceleration maximum

degree.name: Bank Angle
degree.tooltip: angle at which we bank left/right when sidestepping or turning while moving forwards

float32.name: Bank Apply Time
float32.tooltip: time it takes us to apply a bank

float32.name: Bank Decay Time
float32.tooltip: time it takes us to recover from a bank

float32.name: Pitch Ratio
float32.tooltip: amount that we pitch up/down when moving up or down

float32.name: Maximum Velocity
float32.tooltip: max velocity when not crouching

float32.name: Maximum Sidestep Velocity
float32.tooltip: max sideways or up/down velocity when not crouching

degree.name: Angular Velocity Maximum
degree.tooltip: turn rate

degree.name: Angular Acceleration Maximum
degree.tooltip: turn acceleration rate

float32.name: Crouch Velocity Modifier
float32.tooltip: how much slower we fly if crouching (zero = same speed)

tagblock.name: Contact Points
tagblock.tooltip: these are the points where the biped touches the ground

tagref.name: Reanimation Character
tagref.tooltip: when the flood reanimate this guy, he turns into a ...

tagref.name: Reanimation/Morph Muffins
tagref.tooltip: the kind of muffins I create to cover my horrible transformation

tagref.name: Death Spawn Character
tagref.tooltip: when I die, out of the ashes of my death crawls a ...

float32.name: Dampening Scale
float32.tooltip: [0,1] 1= very slow changes

float32.name: Roll Delay
float32.tooltip: [0,1] 1= roll fast and late

float32.name: Cannonball Off-Axis Scale
float32.tooltip: [0,1] weight

float32.name: Cannonball Off-Track Scale
float32.tooltip: [0,1] weight

float32.name: Lobbing Desire
float32.tooltip: 1= heavy arc, 0= no arc

plugin.comment: The cost of the vault check is scaled By Maximum horizontal distance divided by min object size. Try to keep that number reasonably low.

float32.name: Vault Arc Amount
float32.tooltip: 1= heavy arc, 0= no arc

plugin.comment: Allows a biped to grab and be grabbed by other bipeds.
Allows a biped to grab and throw crate objects.

stringid.name: Attach Marker
stringid.tooltip: The marker on the biped to which we attach the grabbed object.

bit.name: Allow Feet Below Grade
bit.tooltip: noramlly, we will force the feet to lock to the ground surface

bit.name: Use Biped Up Direction
bit.tooltip: for characters that climb walls

bit.name: Snap Marker Above Contact
bit.tooltip: prevents ground marker from going below the contact point

float32.name: Ground Normal Dampening
float32.tooltip: react to slope changes (0=slow, 1= fast)

float32.name: Root Offset Maximum Scale Idle
float32.tooltip: vertical drop to ground allowed (0=none, 1=full)

float32.name: Root Offset Maximum Scale Moving
float32.tooltip: vertical drop to ground allowed (0=none, 1=full)

float32.name: Root Offset Dampening
float32.tooltip: react to root changes (0=slow, 1= fast)

float32.name: Following Camera Scale
float32.tooltip: root offset effect on following cam (0=none, 1=full)

float32.name: Root Leaning Scale
float32.tooltip: lean into slopes (0=none, 1=full)

float32.name: Stance Width Scale
float32.tooltip: scale pill width to use as stance radius

degree.name: Foot Roll Maximum
degree.tooltip: orient to ground slope (degrees)

degree.name: Foot Pitch Maximum
degree.tooltip: orient to ground slope (degrees)

float32.name: Foot Normal Dampening
float32.tooltip: (0=slow, 1= fast)

float32.name: Foot Displacement Upward Dampening
float32.tooltip: (0=slow, 1= fast)

float32.name: Foot Displacement Downward Dampening
float32.tooltip: (0=slow, 1= fast)

float32.name: Foot Pull Threshold Distance Idle
float32.tooltip: amount past the authored plane the foot can be pulled (wu)

float32.name: Foot Pull Threshold Distance Moving
float32.tooltip: amount past the authored plane the foot can be pulled (wu)

float32.name: Foot Turn Minimum Radius
float32.tooltip: minimum radius at which foot is fit to turn radius

float32.name: Foot Turn Maximum Radius
float32.tooltip: maximum radius at which foot is fit to turn radius

float32.name: Foot Turn Threshold Radius
float32.tooltip: foot is fit to turn radius fully at minimum plus threshold and above

float32.name: Foot Turn Rate Dampening
float32.tooltip: (0=slow, 1= fast)

float32.name: Foot Turn Weight Dampening
float32.tooltip: dampening of fitting value for fit to turn radius(0=none, 1=fast)

float32.name: Foot Turn Blend On Time
float32.tooltip: time to blend on the foot turn effect (seconds)

float32.name: Foot Turn Blend Off Time
float32.tooltip: time to blend off the foot turn effect (seconds)

float32.name: Pivot-On-Foot Scale
float32.tooltip: (0=none, 1=full)

float32.name: Pivot Minimum Foot Delta
float32.tooltip: vert world units to find lowest foot

float32.name: Pivot Stride Length Scale
float32.tooltip: leg length * this = stride length

float32.name: Pivot Throttle Scale
float32.tooltip: pivoting slows throttle (0=none, 1= full)

float32.name: Pivot Offset Dampening
float32.tooltip: react to pivot changes (0=slow, 1= fast)

float32.name: Pivot Force Turn Rate
float32.tooltip: turn no matter what the pivot state is (0=control turn, 1= always turn)

float32.name: Ideal Pelvis Over High Foot Scale
float32.tooltip: ideal ratio of distance from the pelvis to pedestal to place pelvis over the highest foot

float32.name: Ideal Pelvis Over Low Foot Scale
float32.tooltip: ideal ratio of distance from the pelvis to pedestal to place pelvis over the lowest foot

plugin.comment: When a locked foot is unsupported, meaning it can't reach the ground, the biped is considered to be hanging over a ledge. You can provide a velocity that will either push the character over the ledge or away from it

float32.name: Push Over Magnitude
float32.tooltip: magnitude of throttle to push over ledges. 0= no push

float32.name: Push Back Magnitude
float32.tooltip: magnitude of throttle to push back from ledges. 0= no push

float32.name: Ledge ik Success Range
float32.tooltip: when unable to IK at least this close, consider the IK failed.

float32.name: Ledge Warning Time
float32.tooltip: secs to warn the player before pushing over a ledge

float32.name: Footlock Scale
float32.tooltip: how much this biped respects foot lock events

float32.name: Footlock Minimum Throttle
float32.tooltip: throttle at which foot lock should be fully on (footlockScale)

float32.name: Footlock Maximum Throttle
float32.tooltip: throttle at which foot lock should be fully off

tagRef.name: Death Particleize
tagRef.tooltip: optional particleization effect definition, if you want this to particleize when it dies

plugin.comment: Allows a biped to lean based on movement.

float32.name: Prediction Seconds
float32.tooltip: predict ahead to determine lean. 0= off, more time=more lean

float32.name: Maximum Lean Angle
float32.tooltip: (degrees) maximum lean amount

float32.name: Maximum Vertical Dip
float32.tooltip: (fraction of leg length)

float32.name: Maximum Lean Angle Sine
float32.tooltip: set on post-process, don't edit!*

float32.name: Maximum Lean Angle Cosine
float32.tooltip: set on post-process, don't edit!*

tagref.name: Regeneration Field Looping Sound
tagref.tooltip: plays when player is inside a RegenField

tagRef.name: Shield Impact Override
tagRef.tooltip: overrides shield impact sound, like when in a Mantis

tagRef.name: Non Shield Impact Override
tagRef.tooltip: overrides regular impact sound, like when in a Mantis

float32.name: Sound Radius Multiplier
float32.tooltip: increases radius of other sounds when piloting this biped (mech)

int32.name: Attachment Index
int32.tooltip: Sound attachment to affect - leave empty for main body

stringid.name: Function
stringid.tooltip: Function to drive the RTPC

stringid.name: Function
stringid.tooltip: Function to trigger the sweetener

float32.name: Switch Point
float32.tooltip: value of the function (between 0 and 1) where the sound is triggered

int32.name: Mode
int32.tooltip: 0 for triggering while function is decreasing, 1 for increasing (more modes to come?)

stringid.name: Rotation Node
stringid.tooltip: bone to rotate to align marker
